channel.title: Social Gathering on Minnesota Cryptocurrency
channel.description: Recent content in Social Gathering on Minnesota Cryptocurrency

item.title: Cryptocurrency Chill + Giveaways
Cryptocurrency Trading
item.description: Time: 04:30 PM on Friday, November 30, 2018 Location: Bruininks 432 For this week’s event, we thought it would be a good idea to discuss trading. We’ll dive into technical analysis, trading techniques, and outlook on the recent bearishness in the market. It would also be a good opportunity to share ideas and interesting projects other members have invested in.

item.title: Battle for Privacy
item.description:
Time: 04:30 PM on Friday, November 16, 2018 Location: Bruininks 432 Privacy coins like Monero and Zcash feature cutting-edge applied cryptography. Privacy, fungibility, and security are important characteristics of money. Join us this Friday to learn more about these privacy coins and how they’re changing the game. We will also discuss the difficulty of developing privacy-focused systems and the best ways for assessing the quality of privacy technologies.
When? Friday, November 16th at 4:30 PM

item.title: Cryptocurrency Deep Dive - Privacy
Cryptocurrency Trading Talk
Mining Workshop
item.description: Time: 04:30 PM on Friday, September 28, 2018 Location: Robert Bruininks Hall 432 Join us this Friday in Bruininks Hall 432 at 4:30p to learn the basics of mining cryptocurrency.

item.title: Ethereum Solidity Coding Session
item.description: Time: 07:00 PM on Wednesday, October 3, 2018 Location: Bruininks Hall 123 Learn Ethereum and Solidity! You can use the programming language Solidity to create smart contracts on the Ethereum blockchain. Some previous experience with object-oriented programming is preferred but not required.

item.title: Cryptocurrency Trading Talk and News
Bitcoin Forks
item.description: Time: 04:30 PM on Friday, October 12, 2018 Location: Bruininks 432 Come to our meeting THIS Friday at 4:30p in Bruininks 432 to learn more about current and future Bitcoin forks!

item.title: Kyle Samera on Entrepreneurship in Crypto
item.description: Time: 04:30 PM on Friday, October 19, 2018 Location: Bruininks 432 Come join us this Friday to hear Kyle Samera discuss his experience starting the cryptocurrency newsletter Unbankd. FREE FOOD will be provided!

item.title: Supply Chain and Cryptocurrency
item.description: Time: 04:30 PM on Friday, October 26, 2018 Location: Bruininks 432 Today’s supply chains are complex and lacking transparency due to lack of inconsistent or unavailable data. Join us this Friday to learn and discuss how blockchains could counter these inefficiencies and add new value; or maybe how traditional databases are still the way to go ¯_(ãƒ„)_/¯

item.title: Crypto Scams
item.description: Time: 04:30 PM on Friday, November 2, 2018 Location: Bruininks Hall 432 FREE CANE’S! Also, the growth of the blockchain and cryptocurrency ecosystem has been exciting. innovations have attracted quit a big crowd over the year, but this also includes a number of bad actors. Join us this Friday to discuss and learn about the scams that have happened in the past and how to avoid the current ones today. This space is a lot more enjoyable if you know how to navigate it!

item.title: Decentralized Exchanges
item.description: Time: 04:30 PM on Friday, November 9, 2018 Location: Bruininks 432 FREE FOOD! Join us this Friday to discuss decentralized exchanges. Normal exchanges provide a single point of failure, which has resulted in numerous hacks and general uncertainty. Decentralized exchanges on the other hand offer a solution as they allow users to retain control of their funds throughout the trading process. We will discuss their advantages, disadvantages, and the status of current projects.
